content: गौर {%<ab>a.</ab>%} (रा|री|{%<ab>f.</ab>%}) {@--1@} White; कैलासगौरं वृषमारुरुक्षोः <ls>R. 2. 35</ls>; द्विरददशनच्छेदगौरस्य तस्य <ls>Me. 59</ls>, <ls n="Me.">52</ls>; <ls>Rs. 1. 6.</ls> {@--2@} Yellowish, pale-red; गोरोचनाक्षेपनितांतगौरे <ls>Ku. 7. 17</ls>; <ls>R. 6. 65</ls>; गौरांगि गर्वं न कदापि कुर्याः <ls>R. G.</ls> {@--3@} Reddish. {@--4@} Shining, brilliant. {@--5@} Pure, clean, beautiful. --रः {@--1@} The white colour. {@--2@} The yellowish colour. {@--3@} The reddish colour. {@--4@} White mustard. {@--5@} The moon. {@--6@} A kind of buffalo. {@--7@} A kind of deer. {@--8@} The planet Jupiter. {@--9@} <ab>N.</ab> of Chaitanya. --रं {@--1@} The filament of a lotus. {@--2@} Saffron. {@--3@} Gold.

गौरी {@--1@} <ab>N.</ab> of Pārvatī; as in गौरीनाथ. {@--2@} A young girl eight years old; अष्टवर्षा भवेद्गौरी. {@--3@} A young girl prior to menstruation, virgin, maid. {@--4@} A woman with a white or yellowish complexion. {@--5@} The earth. {@--6@} Turmeric. {@--7@} A yellow pigment or dye; (called गोरोचना). {@--8@} The wife of Varuṇa. {@--9@} The Mallikā creeper. {@--10@} The Tulasī plant. {@--11@} The Mañjiṣṭhā plant. {@--12@} Speech.
